fields.description:
Am unable to clone my wiki using TortoiseGit

Error I get is "Dissconnected: No supported authentication methods available (server sent: publickey)"

I have my SSH setup in my user account which works fine for the repository.

Any help on this would be apreciated.
fields.summary: Cloning Wiki

fields.description: You broke the <guid> of commits in the feed at https://bitbucket.org/<user>/rss/feed , so that commits won't show up in some feed readers, for example Thunderbird. Issues with feed guids has appeared and been fixed numerous times. I first noticed it when comments in commits didn't show up in the feed. That was fixed, but later the same thing happened to created issues. Now that is fixed, but now the commits are not shown in the feed. All commits have <guid isPermaLink="true">https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>/commits/all</guid> which means that a feed reader would see all the entries as one, and ignore all but the first entry. Please remember that the <guid> of each feed entry must be unique (that is the "u" in "guid"), even if the link is to the same page.
fields.summary: Feed guids broken again. (BB-7898)

fields.description:
On "compare view" I can select a bookmark from the dropdown on a fork, but I can't create a pull request from that bookmark.  Going to the pull request UI, I can create a pull request from a changeset that happens to _be_ a bookmark, but there's no bookmark section in the dropdown -- only named branches.

It would be great to have bookmarks in the Pull Request dropdown and to be able to create a Pull Request from a bookmark in the compare view.  Since these are somewhat analogous to "feature branches" it would also be nice to be able to close/delete them on PR, like branches.
fields.summary: Ability to create a pull request from a Mercurial bookmark

fields.description:
When a developer makes a pull request, I may want to accept it, but need to make minor tweaks (e.g., fix spelling). It looks nitpicky and isn't a good use of time to force the original submitter, who may be new to Git and to the site, to update their PR.

In such cases, I normally bring their pull request into a local branch, fix it up slightly, then push it (without merging) so that others can look at my version. The problem is that we have to "Decline" every PR that isn't merged verbatim, which looks like rejection to the author even though we accepted it in spirit.

It would be much better if I could make the replacement PR an alternative to the original, so that the original PR could be marked as superseded/accepted with modifications instead of Declined.
fields.summary: Supersede pull request (BB-10064)
Corrupt branch field on certain POST Web Hook calls

The email on file is promax@teams.bitbucket.org... doubtful that I can confirm this address.

If I try to put in my email address, I get the error "darian@promaxonline.com is already in use by another user."

Do i put in a third email address, or is this just a quirk with the OnDemand/BitBucket integration?

Currently, we get notification of new comments in the lower right, but it would be _much_ better to make the comments appear without needing a reload and without losing the user's place in an incomplete comment. G+ and Facebook comments work like this, for example.
fields.summary: Commenting without needing to reload page (BB-7860)

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot. When I try to load a side-by-side diff, the right side is actually displayed below the left side. This is with Chrome 25.0.1364.172 on Ubuntu Linux. It works fine in Firefox.

 

 

Editing to add *+workarounds+*:
 * Either reset browser zoom to 100%


 * Or enable new pull request experience by logging in to bitbucket.org > select your avatar (bottom left corner) > *Labs* > find and enable the "New pull request experience"
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff doesn't display correctly when zoomed out in Chrome (BB-7897)

fields.description:
I'm usually a very cautious guy when it comes to email addresses on the internet. Rule of thumb: *Never write email addresses in plain text* (to prevent spammers from harvesting it).

Just a few minutes ago I got shocked because I found out that BitBucket prints email addresses for unmapped user in plain text in the wiki file history.

For example, have a look here:

https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/wiki/history/developers/MacOSX

There are several commits I did before I changed my email address on BitBucket. When I changed my email address, I guess those commits became "unmapped". So now these commits have my private email address in plain text in their links.

I know my email address is now probably recorded for eternity in the wiki's repository, but for the future: Could you please *not* include the email address in the author field when editing a wiki. For me (and probably not just for me) this is a huge privacy concern.

Also, please hide those email addresses from the wiki history. Don't make it too easy for spammers to harvest email addresses.
fields.summary: Email addresses publically visible in wiki history

fields.description:
Currently, according to your support staff (see ticket [BBS-2534|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BBS-2534]), A repository owner that creates a Team can be removed from that team by another admin on that same Team.

IMO, this is a big flaw and should not be allowed.  While it is important that one trusts whom they allow to be an Admin on their Team, the creator/owner of that Team should never be allowed to be removed by another Team admin.

The only way the owner/creator of a Team should be removed from that Team is if they explicitly do it themselves, or they transfer the Team to a new owner.

I hope that this suggested change can be made quickly, because I wouldn't want to risk losing access to my Team for any reason (disgruntled member, compromised member's account, etc.)

Regards,

Kevin Powick
fields.summary: Team creator/owner removed by another admin

fields.description:
Hi there,

I would like to request you to support two-factory authentication. Specifically, the yubikey device. This request is similar but not equal to BCLOUD-5811.

The yubikey is a very nice, easy to use, affordable and secure OTP system that will allow you to easily integrate it into your own system.

For details: http://www.yubico.com/products/yubikey-hardware/yubikey/

They have many ways to integrate, but in your case using the Web API is probably easiest. They (Yubico) already provide code to make things easier.

For details: http://www.yubico.com/develop/open-source-software/web-api-clients/

Disclaimer: I'm not involved in anyway with Yubico.
fields.summary: Support for Two-Factor authentication using Yubikey OTP token (BB-7829)

fields.description:
For projects with access restricted to only a team, the pull request's assignee field should only show the team members. Current behavior is to show any matching user, seemingly autocompleting from some global Bitbucket user list.

Although autocompleting an unauthorized user isn't allowed (Bitbucket properly says "John Smith does not have access to view this pull request"), it's still disconcerting to see total strangers pop up in the autocomplete list.

To duplicate, create a pull request (for a restricted access project) and slowly type in a few characters in the assignee field. You should see unauthorized users show up.
fields.summary: @username autocomplete displays unauthorized users (BB-7840)

fields.description:
Right now, retrieving unapproved changesets is a very expensive operation, as you first have to retrieve all changesets then query one by one if it has been approved.  This should be possible to do in one resource.

This is needed by the Review Master plugin.

fields.description:
Right now, the only way to get comments is to get all changesets.  Would be nice to be able to get the latest X comments for a repository.

This is needed for the Review Master plugin.
fields.summary: REST API resource for retrieving last 50 comments (BB-7895)

fields.description: I want to logout of my bitbucket account but scroll bar doesn't scroll.down
fields.summary: can't logout on phone

fields.description:
Workflow:

# Alice creates pull request with commits A, B, C.
# Bob reviews the request, leaving myriad comments.
# Alice addresses the comments via commits D and E, and adds them to the pull.
# Bob reviews the changes made in D & E and approves.
# Alice merges the pull.

Currently, to accomplish (4), Bob has to review the changes in D and E individually in the commit view, or aggregated with commits A-C in the overview.  In no view, can he examine D & E together.

This could be accomplished be allow the "Base" of the overview to be specified by commit.  By default, it is set to the earliest commit of the pull, "A" in our example.  At step (4), Bob can set the base to "D".  Assuming there were further changes necessary and another round of changes, it could later be updated to "F" and so on.  This base is purely a way to restrict the diff view, it does not affect what is being merged.

As a point of reference, reviewboard.org supports this functionality (in a buggy fashion) via their diff revision.

Without this feature, the user can try to ensure that every round of review changes are submitted via a single commit, possibly using git commit --amend to squash together changes.  In addition, in the commit view, the comments on the main overview are not visible.

Since an (imperfect) workaround exists, marking as minor, although I believe this is a differentiating feature among code review tools.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow the reviewer to choose the base commit for the pull request Overview (BB-7951)

fields.description:
Very minor issue, but here we go.

I am part of a Team under an organization.

I created a new private repo for the organization and pushed some code into it.  I received an email saying:

"You have hereby been granted read access to oliverwymantechssg/oaf.deploymentinfo."

That's silly, I have both read and write permission. Heck I just created the darn repo and pushed code to it.

fields.description: I have a project where I commit a markdown file with API documentation. I also often share a link to the file so that other developers can read it (e.g. https://bitbucket.org/tburch/sampleProject/src/d8ecc190d82168ead837745dc58ab10e65d27c81/api.md?at=master). The problem with this is that the link is always to the file at that commit and they have to interact with the UI to get the lastest version. I'd love to be able to give them a link (like https://bitbucket.org/tburch/sampleProject/src/api.md?at=master) where it always returns the latest version of the file for the given branch. Is there a way to do this? If not, I'd love to have this feature added to BB.
fields.summary: Support direct links to source files on a given branch

fields.description:
There should be an option in account configuration to disable the forgot password (password reset) functionality.

In many applications, even a bank account app, for example, there is a limit to the damage that could be done by unauthorized account usage and in most cases the damage is fixable.  One can recover from it.

Source code is often very different in that once somebody gets it, it can almost immediately be available to all the wrong people in the world and that can never be taken back or undone.  For this reason I would like to see the ability to lock down access more.

For a source code repository with reset password functionality via email, there is an additional system that is required to be secure.... the email system and all paths the email may travel between the source control (sending) servers and the receiving email servers.  This introduces so many more weak links such as all employees having access to email servers, domain security and all lines the email itself may travel, since the email itself is not encrypted.

Therefor, although bitbucket may be secure, anybody could gain access to the email systems, domain systems or network the email may travel through and simply click the forgot password button to get an email to reset the password, get the reset link, login and grab the source code.

For this reason, myself and others would like to see a feature to disable forgot password functionality.  When this disable option is selected, clicking the forgot password link on login would ultimately result in nothing happening.  I figure I am responsible enough to keep track of my password and accept all responsibility of it being lost, without ability to reset.  Essentially on a lost password scenario my account is dead even.  Worst case, I would have to create the account again.  Since it's a git distributed VCS, the repository exists other places in active use outside bitbucket so it is not lost.  I would rather accept this risk than accepting the risk that somebody could gain access to my email and get to the source code in my account.
fields.summary: Optionally disable forgot password functionality

fields.description:
Hi there,

it would be great if I could add users to a Team account by sending them an invitation link by eMail which they can accept with their individual bitbucket accounts.

For example, let there be a Team account in which I want to add 50 users (or even more – why not?). I don't want to manually add those 50+ users one by one. Nobody wants that. But now imagine an invitation link that I can send around those users via a private mailing list. The users in question then can follow the link, log in with their individual accounts and accept that invitation. Wouldn't that be great?
fields.summary: Add users to a team with an invitation link (BB-10062)

fields.description:
I just created a new team account username of "arenabt". I did that as a previously unknown user without being logged into any existing BitBucket accounts.

As part of that registration process I added my personal account as a member "LachlanG". The "LachlanG" account was added successfully as an administrator. I added no other members.

However upon inspecting the list of members I saw that there were 2 members not 1. There was my account "LachlanG" and also another account "lachlang" who had also been added as an account administrator.

I've since messaged "lachlang" who it turns out is a real person who says they registered only recently via their github account.

I've removed "lachlang" from our list of members so there is no problem right away but it is troubling that a stranger received administrator access to our albeit empty team account.
fields.summary: Stranger added as administrator of our new team account

fields.description:
This is not a bug per se -- but it's something that I desperately want.

I guess the Bitbucket "Inbox" is equivalent to Github notifications.

I want the inbox to show up very prominently on the "Blue bar" and NOT as a "menu item" (which it currently is). This is important because I don't want to have to remember to click the menu to know if there are any pending notifications -- I want notifications/messages to pop into my eye right away as soon as I log in.

This is what Github does -- I know you don't like hearing about your biggest rival -- but there are some things they do better -- and you can copy them (or may be implement them better).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Show inbox icon in top header (BB-8602)

fields.description:
Hello,

I believe it's possible to gain admin access to any account which hasn't got a 'premium' subscription.

Fairly simple really, generate a invoice link to upgrade their account. The email addresses you provide automatically gain admin access to the associated account without any authorisation from the origin account.

While it leaves a fairly good audit trail (unless you're using a stolen CC) it should allow you to escalate rights on any account.

Hopefully I'm wrong
fields.summary: Admin privilege escalation security bug

fields.description:
On the single commit screen, there is a "raw commit" link. Currently when using that link in a Mercurial repository, it uses the "hg export" format, which includes commit message, authorship, date, time and other metadata.

The git raw commit feature, however, shows a plain old diff: https://bitbucket.org/intgr/pg_journal/commits/fc6d9ee81c812b59dbbbe57c7f22fe3d1b1f1a31/raw/

I believe it would be better to use the git mbox export format, produced by "git format-patch" -- which also preserves message, author, date etc.
fields.summary: Git "raw commit" feature should use git mbox format (BB-7813)

fields.description: They appear in my dashboard in All and Following
fields.summary: Cant unfollow private(no longer participant) repositories (BB-8246)

fields.description:

New interface has only recently used list as opposed to all\\

fields.description:

You could add a cancel button or something to end it manually.

fields.description:
I get this message:

This account has an unconfirmed email address. If you haven't received a confirmation, visit the email page to resend it.

When I request the email, and click on the link I received, I get

You are already a member of this group.

This is going around in circle and my email cannot be confirmed.
fields.summary: Cannot confirm email

the issue which numer is 4 not resolved on my privare repo.

i open issue service.

fields.description:
Hi all. If you could properly document the java code as you write it, I will be much more able to begin implementing interaction with the views and Model/Controllers.\\
It's quite hard to read through blocks of undocumented java code I'm unfamiliar with.

Cheers!
fields.summary: Java Documentation

my user doesn't seem to get any email when someone mentions my self in my project.\\
Any ideas? How can i help finding the bug?

fields.description:
On my current project the issues are not auto closed when I do a commit with the following message:

closes BCLOUD-12: Fixed the tooltip for the clusters

README.rst on overview page does not display code blocks (BB-7801)

fields.description:
Hello,

I'd like to point out that by using the sign up user-mention interface requests someone can generate a list with all the exact usernames you have on Bitbucket. This decreases the security of the website.\\
https://bitbucket.org/xhr/user-mention?term=jon

I'm not sure you want this be accessible to everyone.

Thanks,

Brad
fields.summary: Account information

fields.description: Hi, I have a code available for download at https://bitbucket.org/baderlab/fast/downloads/FAST.tar.gz\\ Now whenever I click the download link, I get the error: This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. AccessDeniedAccess Denied4E0DD51D9D0C018C4xmRZG3Q1c7rJsSyc0TojiL6kuGZTxheQnDhsKCP5m2J3Nmu+iEVl9M34qC7VSLc The error persists even after deleting and re-uploading the FAST.tar.gz. However it is downloadable by the command wget https://bitbucket.org/baderlab/fast/downloads/FAST.tar.gz This is a real bad bug in bitbucket and if this persists, I may never trust bitbucket again. The file FAST.tar.gz is part of a paper recently submitted and if other people cannot download it by clicking the link, bitbucket is pretty useless.
fields.summary: Urgent

fields.description:
In the create repository screen, you are allowed to select a programming language from the list. However, Rust is not an option.

Would you please add Rust as an option? (www.rust-lang.org)
fields.summary: Rust is a programming language

fields.description:
Commit messages that would create comments on issues or close open tickets are not working.  Something has happened in the last 7 days that has changed how the issue service works.

I've reread the docs for it, https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+Up+the+Issues+Service  to confirm that this is not an end user thing.  I've also confirmed that the Issue service is still enabled for the repos (it is).
fields.summary: Issue Service not working correctly.

fields.description:
Hello,

If I attempt to download https://bitbucket.org/aardvarkcomputersolutions/zfsx/get/default.tar.gz  (or end it in .zip)

I get this on my FreeBSD 9 systems:

$ gzip -d *.gz\\
gzip: 1265ebd0144a.tar.gz: not in gzip format\\
$ tar xvf default.tar.gz\\
tar: Unrecognized archive format\\
tar: Error exit delayed from previous errors.

Same problem with .zip - unzip won't work with it.

However, on a windows machine, a download of a .zip works, and opens up with the windows explorer.

Am I just not understanding something, or is the packager making broken files?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Source downloads in .zip or .tar.gz seem to be incompatible with Unix unzip or tar

fields.description:
I've executed *GIT_TRACE=1 git push -u origin develop* command.

This is the output:

trace: built-in: git 'push' '-u' 'origin' 'develop'

trace: run_command: 'git-remote-https' 'origin' 'https://leodido@bitbucket.org/leodido/impr.git'

error: Failed connect to bitbucket.org:8080; Connection timed out while accessing https://leodido@bitbucket.org/leodido/impr.git/info/refs

fatal: HTTP request failed

Some suggests?

Thanks in advance,\\
Leo.
fields.summary: Cannot push to my private repository: HTTP request failed

fields.description: Currenlty, the only way to access the Bitbucket RSS feeds for repositories is to use the supplied token.
fields.summary: Allow RSS access via basic authentication (BB-7800)

fields.description:
As this currently breaks services posting to self-signed SSL hosts.

Also, not all public CA's are in our CA database.
fields.summary: Service brokers should not insist on signed SSL certs
